alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 6:32PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacting The Area Tonight, Into Tuesday Night... .A winter storm will bring impactful and hazardous winter weather to the region late tonight into Tuesday night. Snow spreads across parts of northeast Iowa and southwest Wisconsin this evening, spreading northeast into southeast Minnesota and western and central Wisconsin overnight. By the Tuesday morning commute, 1 to 2 inch per hour snowfall rates are likely across parts of northeast Iowa and southwest into central Wisconsin. Early morning motorists should be prepared for slippery to hazardous travel, especially south of Interstate 90. The snow persists into the afternoon, gradually shifting east of the Mississippi River by the evening. The bulk of the accumulating snow will then exit into eastern Wisconsin by midnight Tuesday. In addition, northwest winds will increase with gusts 30 to 40 mph at times Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday night. This will result in blowing and drifting snow, especially across unsheltered areas and along ridgetops. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow with snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
